definitions.definition: To make a bargain; to make a deal or contract for the exchange of property or services; to negotiate ; to haggle.
examples: They had to bargain for a few minutes to get a decent price for the rug.

definitions.definition: To transfer for a consideration; to barter ; to trade

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To make a bargain; to make a deal or contract for the exchange of property or services; to negotiate ; to haggle.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To transfer for a consideration; to barter ; to trade
